text: Map showing Bijga Bijga also known as Henchir-Bijga is a place in Tunisia, North Africa, near the city of Tunis. ==History== During the Roman Empire it was known as Bisca and was a Civitas (town) of the Roman province of Africa.http://www.gcatholic.org/dioces/former/to316.htm. The town was also the seat of an ancient Christian bishopric, which although ceasing to function with the Muslim conquest of the Maghreb, survives today as a titular see of the Roman Catholic Churchcatholic-hierarchy.org/diocese/d2b64.html. The ruins of the ancient town can still be seen. ==References== Category:Roman towns and cities in Tunisia Category:Catholic titular sees in Africa
title: Bijga
